articles.headline: Stock Exchange Snooping: Mumbai Police Ex Chief Sanjay Pandey Arrested
articles.description: National Stock Exchange's former chief executive officer Chitra Ramkrishna has already been arrested, last week

articles.headline: Video: Fire At 4-Storey Residential Building In Delhi, 12 Rescued
articles.description: A fire broke out at a four-storey residential building in Delhi today. Five fire engines are at the spot who have rescued 12 people so far.

articles.headline: Delhi Metro's Blue Line (Dwarka-Noida Route) Hit After "Cable Theft"
articles.description: Several Delhi Metro commuters faced hardship on Tuesday as services on a section of the Blue Line were delayed due to a major technical issue, officials said.

articles.headline: Denied Admission, Woman Delivers Baby Outside Delhi Hospital
articles.description: A video of a woman delivering her baby outside Safdarjung Hospital's emergency wing after she was allegedly denied admission by the Centre-run facility here went viral on social media on Tuesday, prompting the Union health ministry to seek a report.

articles.headline: Mining Will Resume In Goa In 6 Months: Chief Minister Pramod Sawant
articles.description: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Tuesday assured the state Legislative Assembly that the mining activities will resume in the state in six months after the auctioning of leases.

articles.headline: Twitter User Posts Video Of Plastic Waste At Mumbai Beach, Internet Says "Never Mess With Nature"
articles.description: Despite several warnings, awareness campaigns, advisory posts and regulations, people in Mumbai can't seem to stop throwing garbage in the sea. And now a shocking video proving the same has surfaced online.

articles.headline: Prayers At Lulu Mall: Yogi Adityanath For "Strict" Action Over "Unnecessary Remarks, Demonstrations"
articles.description: As video of some men offering namaz at mall went viral, some outfits sought action; police have since arrested several people over prayers, protests

articles.headline: Delhi Man Dies After Being Hit With Bricks, Stones Over Parking: Cops
articles.description: A man was killed after being allegedly hit with stones and bricks by a group of men following an argument over parking near Delhi's Saket Metro station, police said on Tuesday.

articles.headline: BJP Protests Against AAP Government In Delhi Over Surge In Power Charges
articles.description: Leaders and workers of the BJP's Delhi unit on Tuesday staged protests across the city, including in front of the Aam Aadmi Party office, over the rise in power charges.

articles.headline: 1 Dead, 18 Injured After Bus Overturns In Uttar Pradesh: Police
articles.description: A passenger was killed and 18 people were injured when a bus overturned in Uttar Pradesh's Etah after its driver lost control over the vehicle, police said on Tuesday.

articles.headline: Kolkata Man Arrested For Cheating Canadian Woman Worth Rs 20.55 Lakh
articles.description: A 26-year-old man was arrested from Kolkata's Phoolbagan area for allegedly duping a Candian woman of Rs 20.55 lakh, police said on Tuesday.

articles.headline: 7 Electric Bikes Catch Fire At Pune Showroom While Charging: Report
articles.description: At least seven electric bikes kept at a showroom in Maharashtra's Pune city were burnt after a fire broke out at the outlet during charging, fire brigade officials said.

articles.headline: Odisha Girl Jumps Off School Building Roof To Escape Rape, Critical: Cops
articles.description: A girl has suffered critical injuries after jumping off the roof of a school building in Odisha's Jajpur district while trying to escape a rape attempt by five men, police said.

articles.headline: Delhi Man Arrested For Circulating Morphed Photos, Videos Of Woman
articles.description: A 23-year-old man was arrested for allegedly sending morphed "nude pictures" and "obscene videos" of a woman to her in-laws, and other relatives on social media in revenge for turning him down, police said Monday.

articles.headline: Droupadi Murmu No Stranger To Being First At Something: From Odisha's Tribal Village To Raisina Hill
articles.description: Droupadi Murmu, BJP-led NDA candidate, is poised to win the presidential polls, though results will be out on July 21. NDTV visited her village in Odisha, tracing her story from when she first left for Bhubaneshwar

articles.headline: Kareena Kapoor's
articles.description: The Delhi Police has roped in Poo, Kareena Kapoor Khans iconic character in Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham to get people to follow traffic rules.

articles.headline: Mumbai Man's Body Found Inside Bed At Home, Wife Missing: Cops
articles.description: The decomposed body of a 23-year-old tailor was found inside the storage area of a bed in his rented home in Mumbai's Sakinaka on Monday and his wife is a suspect as she is missing, a police official said.

articles.headline: Model Arrested With Drugs Worth 1 Crore. He Operated In Delhi University
articles.description: Delhi Police today arrested a model and his friend with drugs worth Rs 1 crore. Police said that the two used to supply drugs around the Delhi University campus.

articles.headline: 6 Die As SUV Falls Into Drain After Hitting Two-Wheeler In Maharashtra: Cops
articles.description: Six persons were killed and one injured when a sports utility vehicle (SUV) hit a two-wheeler and fell off a bridge into a nullah in Maharashtra's Amravati district, a police official said on Monday.

articles.headline: Vehicle Owners With No Valid Pollution Certificate To Get Notices In Delhi
articles.description: The Delhi government has started sending notices to vehicle owners without valid Pollution Under Control certificates asking them to get one or face penalty, officials said on Monday.

articles.headline: "80% Hindus": Lucknow Mall Rubbishes Muslim Bias Charge After Namaz Row
articles.description: Two people were recently arrested after they entered the Lulu Mall on Saturday and started reciting the Hanuman Chalisa, police said. At least 15 others were detained for creating a ruckus while trying to enter the shopping mall.

articles.headline: "Something For The Soil": Odisha Congress Legislator Votes For NDA's Droupadi Murmu
articles.description: "It's my personal decision as I've listened to my heart," says Odisha Congress MLA Mohammed Moquim

articles.headline: 2 Teens Drown In Pond While Bathing In Madhya Pradesh: Report
articles.description: Two teenagers drowned while bathing in a pond at a village in Madhya Pradesh's Tikamgarh district, police said on Monday. The incident took place at Acharra village, around 48 km from the district headquarters.

articles.headline: Development Should Not Be At Cost Of Nature: Delhi Environment Minister
articles.description: Development should not come at the cost of nature and there is a pressing need to find a balance between the two, Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai has said on the Centre's proposal to decriminalise environmental laws.

articles.headline: Ailing Teen Rescued From Village Cut Off By Flood In Maharashtra: Report
articles.description: A 17-year-old boy, who was critically ill and in urgent need of medical treatment, was rescued from a remote village cut off by flood waters in Maharashtra's Chandrapur district in a joint effort by the locals and authorities.

articles.headline: Delhi Man Shot Dead By Friend in Azadpur: Police
articles.description: A 23-year-old man was shot dead in Azadpur area allegedly by one of his friend after heated arguments over a minor issue, police said on Sunday.

articles.headline: 70-Year-Old Woman Stabbed To Death By Son In Uttar Pradesh: Cops
articles.description: A 70-year-old woman was stabbed to death by her 32-year-old son in a village in Uttar Pradesh's Sant Kabir Nagar, the police said on Sunday.

articles.headline: Protests In Tamil Nadu After 17-Year-Old Girl Found Dead In School
articles.description: Violence broke out on Sunday nearKallakurichi as protesters demanding justice over the death of a girl student went on a rampage setting fire to vehicles and indulged in stone-throwing

articles.headline: Minor Girl Raped, Forced To Drink Acid By Factory Manager In Delhi: Cops
articles.description: A 15-year-old girl was allegedly raped by the manager of a factory here where she worked and forced to drink acid by her tormentor, police said on Saturday.

articles.headline: Bus Runs Over Man After He Falls Off His Bike That Hit Pothole In Maharashtra: Report
articles.description: A man died after a bus ran over him after he fell from his motorcycle that hit a pothole on GB Road in Maharashtra's Thane city on Tuesday, a civic official told Press Trust of India.

articles.headline: Minor Detained For Putting Explosive Device In Courier Parcel To Claim Insurance
articles.description: According to the police, the boy came across an online advertisement for an insurance policy for the goods damaged during transportation and hatched a plan to get easy money.

articles.headline: Law Minister Present, Ashok Gehlot Makes Sharp Comments On Judiciary, PM
articles.description: Mr Gehlot was speaking at the inaugural ceremony of the 18th All India Legal Services Authorities' Meet in Rajasthan's Jaipur.

articles.headline: "Will Tell You What Is Free
articles.description: In a pointed attack seemingly directed at PM Modi, Arvind Kejriwal said, "When you forgive thousands of crores in loans for your friends, that is free revdi. When you go for foreign trips, and seek contracts for your friends, that is free revdi."

articles.headline: "Half-Complete": Akhilesh Yadav Targets PM Modi Over UP's New Expressway
articles.description: On the day Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Bundelkhand Expressway, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav accused the government of rushing to open the "half-complete" expressway and championing a "chaltaau" culture.

articles.headline: Eknath Shinde Cabinet Approves Renaming Of 2 Maharashtra Cities
articles.description: The Eknath Shinde-led government in Maharashtra on Saturday gave a cabinet approval to rename Aurangabad and Osmanabad cities as Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar and Dharashiv respectively.

articles.headline: Heavy Rain In Delhi, Several Areas Waterlogged
articles.description: Heavy rain pounded Delhi and its adjoining areas on Saturday causing waterlogging and traffic jams at several locations.

articles.headline: Video: Man Shot In The Face By Juvenile In Delhi, 4 Arrested, Say Police
articles.description: A 36-year-old man was shot in the face allegedly by a juvenile in northwest Delhi's Jahangirpuri area, police said today. The four juveniles have been arrested in connection with the incident, they added.

articles.headline: Senior Government Official Found Dead In UP, Suicide Suspected: Cops
articles.description: The deputy general manager (DGM) of NTPC in Uttar Pradesh's Dadri was found dead last night in his office premises, officials said today.

articles.headline: Delhi's Maximum Temperature At 38.5 Degrees, Light Rain Likely Tomorrow
articles.description: It was a warm and humid day in Delhi on Friday with the maximum temperature settling at 38.5 degrees Celsius, three notches above normal, the India Meteorological Department said.

articles.headline: Give For Adoption: Delhi High Court To Pregnant Woman Who Sought Abortion
articles.description: The Delhi High Court on Friday said it will not permit an unmarried woman to undergo medical termination of pregnancy at 23 weeks, observing it virtually amounts to killing the foetus.

articles.headline: "Wasn't Comparing": Bihar Police Officer On Citing RSS For How Popular Front Of India Works
articles.description: As partner BJP got angry at SSP Manavjeet Singh Dhillon, Chief Minister Nitish Kumar yesterday asked top police officers to seek explanation from him in 48 hours

articles.headline: Seized Near Mumbai, This Is What Rs 362 Crore Worth Heroin Looks Like
articles.description: The Navi Mumbai police's crime branch has seized heroin valued at Rs 362.5 crore in the international market from an unclaimed shipping container.

articles.headline: Watch: Girl vs Boy Metro Fight Over "Rs 1,000 Zara T-Shirt" Is Peak Delhi
articles.description: The video has racked up over a quarter of a million views on Twitter in three days, with some raising the possibility that it may have been scripted.

articles.headline: Elderly Man Jumps On Tracks At Kolkata Metro Station, Rescued
articles.description: Metro rail services in Kolkata were affected along the Dakshineshwar-Kabi Subhas route during peak office hours on Friday, after a person jumped on the tracks at the Kalighat station, an official said.

articles.headline: Viral Video: At UP Teacher's Farewell, Students Weep, Refuse To Let Him Go
articles.description: In a part of Uttar Pradesh where schools are notoriously deficient in attendance, visuals of a teacher's farewell with heartbroken students clinging to him and weeping, have gone viral.

articles.headline: Goa Man Beaten To Death For Not Allowing Gatecrashers At Birthday Party
articles.description: A man was beaten to death on his 22nd birthday in a slum near Margaon town in South Goa allegedly by some persons he was acquainted with after he objected to their attempt to gatecrash the celebration, police said.

articles.headline: Delhi Girl Gang-Raped In Car, Accused Drove Around City, Filmed Act
articles.description: A 16-year-old girl was kidnapped from near her home and then gang-raped inside a car in Delhi, the police said today. The horror reportedly went unnoticed as the accused men drove the car from Vasant Vihar in south Delhi to Mahipalpur.

articles.headline: Mumbai Man, Who Posed As IPS Officer On Matrimonial Sites, Arrested
articles.description: A man was arrested for duping a woman and posing as an Indian Police Service (IPS) officer in Mumbai, according to the police.

articles.headline: Ajmer Dargah Cleric Arrested For Inflammatory Remarks Against Nupur Sharma
articles.description: Ajmer Dargah Khadim Gauhar Chishti, who was on the run after raising objectionable slogans against Nupur Sharma, was arrested in Telangana's Hyderabad on Thursday.

articles.headline: 2 Journalists Shot At By Unidentified Assailants In UP: Police
articles.description: Two journalists working for local newspapers were allegedly shot at by unidentified assailants in Kaliyari market area here, police said on Thursday.

articles.headline: 2 Dams Supplying Water To Mumbai Start Overflowing After Heavy Rainfall
articles.description: At least two dams supplying water to Mumbai and located in Palghar district - Modak Sagar and Tansa - have started overflowing due to incessant rains in their catchment areas, an official said on Thursday.

articles.headline: Delhi Woman Dies By Suicide Allegedly Over "14 Forced Abortion"
articles.description: A 33-year-old woman allegedly committed suicide after being "forced to undergo abortion 14 times" by her live-in partner in a span of eight years, police said on Thursday citing a suicide note.

articles.headline: Delhi Class 12 Boy Arrested For Stabbing Classmates Amid Quarrel: Cops
articles.description: A student was arrested for allegedly stabbing his classmates following a quarrel at a government school in south Delhi's Bhati Mines area, police said on Thursday.

articles.headline: India's First Monkeypox Case In Kerala, Centre Rushes High-Level Team
articles.description: Kerala Health Minister Veena George says he landed at Thiruvananthapuram airport and all WHO guidelines are being followed

articles.headline: Traffic Cop Chases Snatcher For 1 Km, Gets Woman's Purse Back
articles.description: A thief running away with a woman's purse in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida was chased down by a traffic police constable on foot after a pursuit of nearly a kilometer, officials said on Thursday.

articles.headline: Selfie Moments At Sealdah Metro Station As Commuter Welcomed With Roses
articles.description: The commuters who boarded the first Metro train to Sealdah, in West Bengal's capital Kolkata, were delighted to be welcomed by the staff with red roses.

articles.headline: New Plan To Curb Severe Pollution In Delhi This Winter. Details Here
articles.description: The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has revamped the Graded Response Action Plan - a set of anti-air pollution measures followed in Delhi and its vicinity according to the severity of the situation.

articles.headline: Caught On Camera: Teenager Driving Car Hits Cyclist In Ghaziabad, Drags Traffic Cop For 2 Kms On Bonnet
articles.description: Some people started chasing the car after spotting the traffic constable on its bonnet and managed to catch it near Yashoda Hospital.

articles.headline: Petrol, Diesel Prices Cut By Rs 5, Rs 3 In Maharashtra: Eknath Shinde's Big Move
articles.description: Cut in tax on petrol, diesel will cost Maharashtra government Rs 6,000 crore a year, but bring down inflation, says Chief Minister Eknath Shinde

articles.headline: Goa's Mopa Airport Set For Inauguration After August 15: Chief Minister
articles.description: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant has said the Mopa international airport, which is expected to double the number of flights landing in the state, will be commissioned after August 15.

articles.headline: 11 Rescued After Residential Building Collapses Due To Heavy Rain In Pune
articles.description: Eleven people were rescued from three houses after an adjoining residential structure collapsed in Maharashtra's Pune city on Thursday morning, fire brigade officials said.

articles.headline: My Government Committed To All-Round Development Of Maharashtra: Eknath Shinde
articles.description: Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said he was a "sevak" and his government was committed to the all-round development of the state as well as welfare of its citizens.

articles.headline: 14-Year-Old Girl Repeatedly Raped For 2 Months In Gurugram: Cops
articles.description: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly repeatedly raped for two months by a man from her neighbourhood in Haryana's Gurugram, police said on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Gurgaon Schoolboy Murder: Recheck Accused's Juvenility Issue, Says Supreme Court
articles.description: Nearly five years after the murder of a child at a Gurugram private school, the Supreme Court on Wednesday said the juvenile accused in the 2017 case should be examined afresh to decide whether he be prosecuted as an adult.

articles.headline: Chhattisgarh Man Dies By Suicide After Killing Girlfriend With Hammer, Blade: Cops
articles.description: A 28-year-old man died by suicide after allegedly killing his girlfriend over suspicion of having an affair in Chhattisgarh's Raipur, police said on Wednesday.

articles.headline: 14 Chinese Nationals Staying Illegally In India Detained: Officials
articles.description: Fourteen Chinese nationals, including a woman, were detained on Wednesday here for allegedly staying in the country illegally since 2020, police officials here said.

articles.headline: Rise In Number Of Patients In Delhi With Covid-Like Symptoms, Say Doctors
articles.description: Many hospitals in Delhi are reporting a rise in number of patients suffering from Covid-like symptoms such as fever, common cold, cough, and bodyache in the last two weeks, doctors said.

articles.headline: 2 Arrested For Burglaries In Mumbai, Used Money For Family Trips: Cops
articles.description: A 42-year-old man and his brother-in-law were arrested for a string of thefts and burglaries in Mumbai who used to spend money on sightseeing with their family members after committing the crime, police said on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Woman, 82, Mauled By Her Pet Pit Bull In Lucknow
articles.description: An 82-year-old woman was mauled to death by her pet dog at her house in the Qaiserbagh area of the city, police said Wednesday.

articles.headline: 47-Year-Old Mumbai Woman Found Dead In Hotel Room, 1 Arrested: Police
articles.description: A 47-year-old woman was found dead in a hotel room in Mumbai on Tuesday, the police said.

articles.headline: Delhi Shopkeeper Attacked By Group Of Men, Family Suspects Shop Owner Role
articles.description: A 46-year-old shopkeeper was severely injured after a group of people allegedly attacked him in North Delhi's Kotwali area, police said on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Rajasthan Man, 35, Stabbed To Death, Monetary Dispute Suspected
articles.description: A 35-year-old grocery shop owner was stabbed to death in Rajasthan's Bhilwara district on Tuesday night, police said.

articles.headline: Watch: Mamata Banerjee Serves 'Pani Puri' To People In Darjeeling
articles.description: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, displaying her innovative skill of communicating with people, on Tuesday made 'pani puris' at a roadside stall in Darjeeling and served the lip-smacking snack to children and tourists visiting the hill.

articles.headline: Accused Jumps Off Court's Building In Gujarat; Dies: Police
articles.description: A senior citizen, who was accused in a cheating case, jumped from the second floor of a court building in Gujarat's Surat city and died, police said on Tuesday.

articles.headline: Man Killed After Being Hit By Speeding Car In South Delhi: Police
articles.description: A 46-year-old man who worked as cashier in a pub was killed after being allegedly hit by a speeding car in south Delhi's Greater Kailash area, police said on Tuesday.

articles.headline: PM Modi's Advice To Tejashwi Yadav: "
articles.description: Health a running theme in conversations between PM Modi and Bihar's Leader of Opposition. While PM Narendra Modi is big on yoga, Tejashwi Yadav used to be a professional cricketer.

articles.headline: Delhi Metro To Soon Roll Out Its First E-Auto Service
articles.description: Delhi Metro would soon roll out its first e-auto service in the national capital, with a batch of 50 such vehicles to be launched from Dwarka Sector-9 station, a move that seeks to boost last mile connectivity for commuters, officials said on Monday.

articles.headline: Rain Causes Waterlogging, Affects Flow Of Traffic In Delhi
articles.description: Commuters on Tuesday witnessed heavy traffic jams in various parts of the national capital due to waterlogging caused by rain. Traffic snarls and waterlogging were reported in several parts, including Burari, Jasola, Pitampura.

articles.headline: Latest In JDU-BJP Frostiness: No 'Welcome PM Modi' Ads By Nitish Kumar's Government
articles.description: A number of senior JDU leaders said the absence of welcome ads from the government "may be a human error". The Bihar alliance has seen some disagreements between the partners over the past few months, a recent one being over the Agnipath scheme.

articles.headline: BJP Has Nothing To Do With "Rebellion" In Goa Congress: Chief Minister Pramod Sawant
articles.description: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant today said the BJP has nothing to do with the "rebellion" in the state Congress Legislature Party.

articles.headline: Heavy Rain In Mumbai, Streets Flooded, Traffic Affected
articles.description: Mumbai Rain: Heavy rain and strong winds lashed Mumbai and suburbs on Tuesday morning and flooded many parts of the city within a couple of hours, throwing road traffic out of gear at some places, officials said.

articles.headline: 16-Year-Old Student Beaten To Death In School, 4 Minors Detained
articles.description: A 16-year-old student was beaten to death allegedly by four boys at a school in Raipur after a verbal duel over a petty issue, police said on Tuesday.

articles.headline: Rains In Delhi Causes Water-Logging, Heavy Traffic In Several Places
articles.description: Rain in the national capital this morning brought down the temperature but caused heavy traffic and water-logging in several parts of the city.

articles.headline: Big Blow To Congress In Uttarakhand As 3 Senior Leaders Join AAP
articles.description: Three senior Congress leaders from Uttarakhand on Monday resigned from the party and joined the Aam Aadmi Party in Delhi.

articles.headline: Delhi Government Launches WhatsApp Chatbot To Answer Queries On Electric Vehicles
articles.description: Delhi Government launched a new WhatsApp chatbot to answer queries related to electric vehicles. From how to procure e-vehicles to their price range and incentives, the chatbot will answer all possible queries.

articles.headline: Trinamool Pitches "Bengal Model" To Tripura, Sets Up Office In Agartala 10 Months Before Polls
articles.description: Mamata Banerjee's party recently set up headquarters in 2 other north-eastern states, Assam and Meghalaya; ambition in Tripura tied to linguistics too

articles.headline: Bengaluru To Become Free Of Stray Dogs Soon, Says Karnataka Minister
articles.description: Karnataka Animal Husbandry Minister Prabhu Chauhan on Monday said that the animal husbandry department is keenly looking at making Bengaluru free of stray dogs.

articles.headline: Another Rajiv Gandhi Assassination Convict, P Ravichandran, Goes To Supreme Court For Release
articles.description: In jail for 30 years, P Ravichandran cites case of fellow convict AG Perarivalan, who came out of jail after 31 years following court order two months ago

articles.headline: Meat Thrown In Gurudwara Premises In Uttar Pradesh, Case Registered: Cops
articles.description: Police have lodged a case after meat was allegedly thrown into a gurudwara premises in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, a senior official said on Monday.

articles.headline: Aaditya Thackeray Faces Legal Tangle Over Children In 'Save Aarey' Protest
articles.description: Aaditya Thackeray got the decision to use Aarey area for a metro rail shed reversed when he was minister in his father Uddhav Thackeray's government; but a lot has changed in the past few weeks.

articles.headline: Rainfall Brings Mercury Down In Delhi
articles.description: Rainfall in the national capital on Monday afternoon brought much needed respite from the weather conditions that had been prevailing over the last few days.

articles.headline: Video: Amid Flood-Like Situation In Gujarat, Several Rescued On Boats
articles.description: Heavy rains pounded parts of south and central Gujarat districts over the last couple of days, sending rivers in spate and causing flood-like situations. Over 6,000 people have been evacuated from several low-lying areas in the affected districts, of

articles.headline: Over 153 Dengue Cases In Delhi This Year, 10 In July: Report
articles.description: Over 150 dengue cases have been reported in the national capital so far this year, including at least 10 cases in July, a civic report said on Monday.

articles.headline: Goa Congress Move Against Mutiny: Wants Speaker To Disqualify Two Of Its MLAs
articles.description: Congress accuses Michael Lobo and Digambar Kamat of a conspiracy in "total coordination" with the BJP

articles.headline: Woman Dies By Suicide By Jumping In Front Of Kolkata Metro Train: Police
articles.description: A woman died after jumping in front of an approaching metro train at Girish Park station in north Kolkata on Monday afternoon, disrupting services on the North-South Line, police said.

articles.headline: On Camera, Madhya Pradesh BJP Leader's Threat For Homes With Congress Flags
articles.description: "Click pictures of all those houses which have Congress flags. Deprive them of all services," a BJP leader is heard telling a crowd in a widely shared video from Madhya Pradesh. As the video went viral on social media, the BJP leader, Prahlad Patel,

articles.headline: Boy Playing With Umbrella Falls To Death From 11th Floor Of Mumbai Highrise
articles.description: A five-year-old boy fell from the window of his 11th floor flat in a housing society in the Byculla area of south Mumbai on Sunday while he was playing with an umbrella, police said.

articles.headline: Lawyer Shoots Self In UP, Family Alleges Harassment By Friends: Cops
articles.description: A 27-year-old advocate shot himself using his father's licensed pistol in the Kavinagar colony of Ghaziabad district in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Sunday.

articles.headline: Delhi's Maximum Temperature Settles At 34.9 Degrees; Rain Likely Tomorrow
articles.description: The maximum temperature in the national capital Sunday evening settled at 34.9 degrees Celsius, a notch below average temperature, with a possibility of light rain on Monday, the India Meteorological Department said.

articles.headline: Delhi Government To Launch Special Drive For Dust-Control Norms: Minister
articles.description: The Delhi government will launch a special drive on July 15 for online registration of construction and demolition sites larger than 500 square metres for self-monitoring of compliance of dust control guidelines, Environment Minister Gopal Rai said.

articles.headline: 24-Year-Old Arrested For Murdering Builder In West Delhi
articles.description: A 24-year-old man was arrested for allegedly murdering a builder-cum-property dealer after the latter allegedly failed to deliver a consignment of pistols to him, police said on Sunday.

articles.headline: "Fight For Life": Aaditya Thackeray Leads Protest Against Metro Car Shed
articles.description: Aaditya Thackeray, Shiv Lena leader and former Maharashtra minister, today led a protest against the state government's move to shift the proposed Metro-3 car shed to Mumbai's Aarey Forest.

articles.headline: Over 10,000 Fire Incidents In Delhi Till June 30 This Year: Authorities
articles.description: The national capital witnessed over 10,350 fire incidents in the first six months of the year claiming lives of 60 people and injuring 395 others, the Delhi Fire Service (DFS) said.

articles.headline: Delhi Sets Up Control Room To Monitor Plastic Ban; Rs 1 Lakh Fine For Violation
articles.description: The Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) has set up a control room to monitor the implementation of the ban on 19 identified single-use plastic items and will start shutting units violating it from Monday, officials said.

articles.headline: Hyderabad Police Inspector On The Run After Rape Complaint, Suspended
articles.description: A case has been registered against a police inspector in Hyderabad for allegedly raping the wife of a man who was arrested by him in 2018, officials said.

articles.headline: Mumbai Man Kills Mother, Then Jumps In Front Of Train, Saved By Cop: Police
articles.description: Depressed over a property issue, a 21-year-old man allegedly killed his 46-year-old mother by slitting her throat with a sharp weapon at their flat in suburban Mulund on Saturday, police said.

articles.headline: Mulayam Singh Yadav's Wife Sadhna Yadav Dies After Prolonged Illness
articles.description: Samajwadi Party (SP) founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's wife Sadhna Yadav died at a private hospital in Gurugram on Saturday after prolonged illness.

articles.headline: Exclusive - Fake Passport Helped Sidhu Moose Wala Plotter Flee India: Cops
articles.description: Sachin Bishnoi - a close associate of jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi - managed to get his hands on a passport on a fake name and flee India after planning the killing, the police said.

articles.headline: 2 People Washed Away In Flooded Waters In Maharashtra: Report
articles.description: Maharashtra Rains: Two men were washed in flooded waters in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi in Thane district after heavy rains. The two separate incidents occurred on Saturday, officials said.

articles.headline: Teen Dies As 250-Year-Old 'Heritage' Tree Falls In Chandigarh School, Inquiry On Amid Questions
articles.description: Activists say "not merely a tree but the entire system has fallen", ask how Chandigarh UT administration could not monitor old trees for potential danger, particularly around schools

articles.headline: Delhi's Maximum Temperature Settles At 39 Degrees, Rain Likely Tomorrow
articles.description: People in Delhi experienced sultry weather on Friday as the maximum temperature was recorded at 39 degrees Celsius, two notches above the season's average, and rain continued to elude the national capital.

articles.headline: Conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar's Woman Aide Arrested, Handled His Money
articles.description: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) said the woman, identified as Pooja, was arrested in Delhi last night.

articles.headline: Passenger On Tracks Delays Services On Delhi Metro's Violet Line
articles.description: "Violet Line Update. Delay in services from Badarpur Border to Raja Nahar Singh (Ballabgarh) due to a passenger on track at Badkal Mor. Normal service on all other lines," the DMRC tweeted.

articles.headline: Hanuman Chalisa Event: Madhya Pradesh Government Vetoes Bhopal College Fine On Students
articles.description: Management of VIT Bhopal had said students can otherwise pray as they please, but no group event is permitted even inside hostel rooms without permission

articles.headline: Student Dies After Tree Falls In Chandigarh School, Many Injured
articles.description: A student died and many others were injured after a tree fell inside a school in Chandigarh on Friday. The school is located in Sector 9 area, as per reports.

articles.headline: Punjab Sacrilege: 7 Years On, 3 Dera Followers Get Jail, All Parties Want Credit
articles.description: Two men were acquitted for want of evidence in the 2015 case in Moga's Malke village, which was one of several such incidents in Punjab at the time

articles.headline: Rains Subside In Mumbai But Red Alert Remains
articles.description: Even as Mumbai residentsgot some respite from the downpour on Friday morning, the IMD has issued a red alert for the city and its suburbs warning that very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall is likely at isolated places during the day, officials said

articles.headline: Noida Man Tries To Redeem Cash Points On Credit Card, Loses Rs 4.50 Lakh
articles.description: A lucrative offer to redeem cash points on credit card cost a Noida resident dearly as he lost over Rs 4.50 lakh to cyber criminals who duped him by posing as bank representatives, according to police.

articles.headline: 10 New Maharashtra Council Members To Take Oath On Friday
articles.description: The ten newly-elected members of the Maharashtra Legislative Council will take oath on Friday, an official said on Thursday.

articles.headline: Mumbai Municipal Body Prohibits Visit To Beaches On Heavy Rainfall Warning
articles.description: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Thursday issued an order prohibiting people from visiting the city beaches on the days for which the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has given an 'orange' or 'red' alert warning of heavy rainfall.

articles.headline: Mumbai Expected To Witness Heavy Rains Today, Red Alert Issued: 10 Facts
articles.description: Mumbai rains are expected to continue unabated with the weather department predicting heavy rainfall today. The city has had no respite from heavy rains since Monday.

articles.headline: Actor-Politician Raj Babbar Gets 2-Year Jail Term In 1996 Assault Case
articles.description: A court in Lucknow gave a two-year jail term to Bollywood actor and Congress leader Raj Babbar in a case involving the assault of a polling officer.

articles.headline: Over 2,500 Kg Of Beef Seized In Mumbai; 10 Held: Police
articles.description: Over 2,500 kg of beef was seized and 10 people were arrested by the Mumbai police in suburban Deonar on Thursday, an official said.

articles.headline: "Probe Agency's Pressure": Sena's Sanjay Raut On Exit Of Ex MP From Party
articles.description: In another blow to the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction, a former Member of Parliament quit the party on Thursday. Anandrao Vithoba Adsul, former Lok Sabha MP from Maharashtra's Amravati resigned as a leader of the Shiv Sena.

articles.headline: Delhi Men Caught With Rs 64 Lakh In Old Notes, Bought Using New Currency
articles.description: The government had discontinued the old currency notes in November 2016, after Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced demonetisation.

articles.headline: Heavy Rain Continues In Mumbai, 3 Hurt In Landslide
articles.description: Three persons were injured in a landslide in Mumbai which continued to get affected by heavy showers for the third straight day on Wednesday, resulting in water-logging at many places and traffic disruptions.

articles.headline: Delhi Transport Corporation's Bus Driver Shot Dead By Men On Bike In Delhi
articles.description: A 45-year-old man who was a bus driver with the Delhi Transport Corporation was shot dead by two unidentified bike-borne men in front of his family in Delhi's Govindpuri, police said on Thursday.

articles.headline: "Indigenous" Muslims: Why Assam Opposition Sees BJP Ploy In Status For 5 Groups
articles.description: Political watchers in Assam say the BJP -- ruling party at the Centre too -- wants to woo Assamese-speaking Muslims, sensing a vote-bank amid a complex cultural mix.

articles.headline: On Camera, Hyderabad Teen Flung Into Air After Being Hit By Car
articles.description: A teenager in Hyderabad was injured after being run over by a car. The incident occurred in the city's Rajendranagar area yesterday.

articles.headline: "Now I'll Also Marry Soon": Groomsman Raghav Chadha Says Bhagwant Mann Made "Wise Choice"
articles.description: Rajya Sabha member Raghav Chadha speaks about who was the happiest at Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann's wedding

articles.headline: Man Sets Wife On Fire Over Marital Dispute In Bhopal: Police
articles.description: A man allegedly set his 22-year-old wife ablaze by pouring petrol on her in public in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal city, police said on Thursday.

articles.headline: Trinamool Congress Leader, Two Aides Murdered In West Bengal Town
articles.description: Swapan Majhi, member of a panchayat in Canning, was on his way to a meeting when attacked around 9am

articles.headline: Man Found Dead In A Drain In Maharashtra Amid Heavy Rains
articles.description: The decomposed body of a man was found in a drain in Maharashtra's Palghar district which has been witnessing heavy rains since the last few days, a fire official said.

articles.headline: It's Pouring Memes On Internet Over Heavy Rain In Karnataka And Mumbai
articles.description: It is that time of the year again when the Southwest Monsoon makes its way to India. Over the past few days, parts of Maharashtra and Karnataka have been receiving extremely heavy rainfall.

articles.headline: Fact-Checker Mohammed Zubair Cites Death Threats In Supreme Court Plea
articles.description: Case meant to threaten him against doing his job, "to put fear among those who stand up against communal elements", says Alt News co-founder's plea

articles.headline: "Quran Says...": Karnataka Right Wing Leader Charged For Hate Speech
articles.description: Speech made in Kolar on July 1, when some people were protesting the killing of tailor Kanhaiya Lal in Udaipur

articles.headline: AIADMK Tussle: OPS Hopes For High Court Halt As EPS Seeks To Wrest Leadership
articles.description: OPS is fighting against attempts by EPS faction to junk the dual leadership system and bring back the post of one supreme General Secretary for AIADMK

articles.headline: Fire At Supermarket In Mumbai's Posh Hiranandani Locality, All Safe
articles.description: A fire broke out in a supermarket in Powai area of Mumbai this morning, a civic official said.

articles.headline: Heavy Rain In Mumbai Likely, Wind Speeds Up To 60 Kmph: Weather Office
articles.description: Mumbai Rain: Very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall is expected at isolated places in Mumbai on Thursday, the weather office said.

articles.headline: Religious Conversion Of Hindus Stopped Within 100 Days In State: Goa Chief Minister
articles.description: Goa Chief Minister Pramod Sawant on Wednesday announced that the religious conversion of Hindus in the state stopped within 100 days of his government assuming office.

articles.headline: Mumbai Girl, 16, Gets Death Threat Over Social Media Post On Udaipur Killing
articles.description: Mumbai police have registered an offence against an unidentified person for allegedly threatening to kill a 16-year-old city-based girl over her Facebook post on the murder of tailor Kanhaiya Lal in Rajasthan's Udaipur,

articles.headline: Gurugram Man Shoots At Woman For Refusing To Marry Him
articles.description: A man shot at a 19-year-old woman here for refusing to marry him, police said on Wednesday. The accused has been arrested.

articles.headline: Man Arrested For Sexually Harassing Woman At Delhi Metro Station
articles.description: A 40-year-old man was arrested in connection with the alleged sexual harassment of a woman at a Delhi Metro station, police said on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Rahul Gandhi Video: Zee News Anchor Goes To Supreme Court, Hearing Tomorrow
articles.description: Video of Rahul Gandhi speaking about men who attacked his office in Kerala was shown as him saying Udaipur tailor's killers be forgiven; channel and anchor have apologised

articles.headline: Cops Scan 100 Hours Of CCTV Footage To Catch Man Accused Of Sexual Assault At Metro Station
articles.description: The woman had narrated her ordeal that took place at a Delhi metro station on June 2 on Twitter.

articles.headline: Pro-Nupur Sharma Post On Facebook Leads To Clash In Bihar's Arrah
articles.description: Two young men squabbled at a tea stall over the social media post before it turned into a full-blown fight with sticks and rods

articles.headline: Won't Let Democracy Die In West Bengal, Says Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar In Latest Swipe
articles.description: State government led by Mamata Banerjee has repeatedly accused Governor Dhankhar of being partisan

articles.headline: "Come Out, My Son": 2 Holed-Up Terrorists Surrender After Family Appeals In Kashmir's Kulgam
articles.description: The two terrorists are in their 20s and were recently recruited; families were desperate to get them back into the mainstream, says army

articles.headline: In Police-vs-Police Over Zee Anchor Rohit Ranjan's Arrest, Question On UP Cops' Move
articles.description: Rohit Ranjan was taken away by police in BJP-ruled UP to allegedly thwart arrest by cops from Congress-run Chhattisgarh over doctored video of Rahul Gandhi

articles.headline: Before Lalu Yadav Is Shifted To Delhi Hospital, A Meet With Nitish Kumar
articles.description: Lalu Prasad Yadav is in Patna hospital due to fracture in shoulder

articles.headline: Delhi Shopping Festival, India's Biggest, In Jan-Feb, 2023: Arvind Kejriwal
articles.description: The national capital will host 'Delhi Shopping Festival' from January 28 to February 26 next year and it will be the country's biggest such event, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced today.

articles.headline: 3rd SpiceJet Incident Yesterday: Cargo Plane's Weather Radar Failed
articles.description: 8 incidents in less than 3 weeks for SpiceJet; after show-cause, airline says "no aircraft will ever fly unless 100 per cent safe"

articles.headline: EPS Gets Legal Leg-Up In AIADMK Leadership Wrangle
articles.description: OPS went to high court which stopped all resolutions, including one for unitary leadership under EPS; Supreme Court removes that hurdle

articles.headline: Leopard Kills Visually Impaired woman In Gujarat
articles.description: A leopard mauled an 80-year-old visually impaired woman to death in Gujarat's Amreli district, a forest official said on Wednesday.

articles.headline: Thane Man Run Over By Bus After Hitting Pothole Amid Heavy Rain
articles.description: A man was run over by a bus as he fell from his motorcycle after hitting a pothole on the Ghodbunder Road in Maharashtra's Thane, the police said today.

articles.headline: Heavy Rain In Mumbai And Suburbs; Train, Bus Services Hit
articles.description: Mumbai Rain: Normal life was affected on Wednesday as heavy rain lashed Mumbai and its suburbs causing waterlogging at several locations.

articles.headline: Mumbai Rains Highlights: Mumbai, On Heavy Rain Alert, Braces For More Showers
articles.description: Mumbai is bracing for more showers and a heavy rain alert has been issued in the city. It has been raining in the financial capital for the past two days.

articles.headline: Army Jawan Drowns While Bathing In Ganga River In Uttarakhand: Police
articles.description: An Army jawan drowned while bathing in the Ganga river near Rishikesh in Uttarakhand on Tuesday, police said.

articles.headline: Father-Son Duo Killed, 2 Girls Injured After Being Hit By Bus In UP
articles.description: A father-son duo travelling by bicycle were killed and two others were injured after being hit by a bus in Bisauli Kotwali area here on Tuesday, police said.

articles.headline: Man Takes Wrong Turn Using Maps In Gurugram, Made To Sweep Road By Cop
articles.description: A man in Gurugram alleged that he was made to sweep the road by a police constable after he took a wrong turn using Google Maps to the stretch leading to the Recruit Training Centre in Bhondsi.

articles.headline: Ex-Mumbai Civic Body Official Dies In Swimming Pool: Cops
articles.description: A 73-year-old retired official of Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) died while swimming at a civic-run swimming pool in suburban Kandivali, police said on Tuesday.

articles.headline: Teen Found Buried Near Delhi Ridge 2 Days After Kidnapping Caught On CCTV
articles.description: A minor was kidnapped at knife-point, stabbed to death, his body was buried and clothes were burnt to hide evidence. All this over a minor dispute.

articles.headline: Delhi High Court Dismisses Plea Filed After A Delay Of 62 Years
articles.description: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday dismissed a plea after noting that it was filed after a delay of 62 years.

articles.headline: Man Run Over By Bus After Motorbike Hits Pothole In Maharashtra: Report
articles.description: A man was run over by a bus on Tuesday when he fell down after his motorcycle hit a pothole on GB Road in Maharashtra's Thane city, a civic official said.

articles.headline: Centre Not Allowing Municipal Polls, Will Approach Court: Arvind Kejriwal
articles.description: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday accused the BJP-led central government of using force and hooliganism in not allowing MCD elections in the city and asserted that the AAP will approach the court to get the polls conducted on time.

articles.headline: Doctors Transferred From Lucknow Hospital, UP Minister Seeks Clarification
articles.description: Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak has written to Additional Chief Secretary, Medical Health, seeking clarifications on recent reshuffle in the health department, saying the government's policy on transfers was not followed.

articles.headline: Delhi High Court Orders Setting Up Of 42 Commercial Courts Within 6 Months
articles.description: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday directed its Registrar General, the Government of NCT Delhi, and others to set up 42 commercial Courts within six months for the speedy redressal of commercial cases.

articles.headline: Mumbai Rains Highlights: Mumbai Waterlogged, On Alert For Heavy Rain
articles.description: Mumbai is witnessing heavy rain since last night, with parts of the city waterlogged and traffic movement affected.

articles.headline: Ola Driver Allegedly Killed Techie In Chennai After Argument Over OTP
articles.description: An Ola driver has been arrested for allegedly killing a passenger over a delay in entering the one-time password or OTP before boarding the cab in Tamil Nadu's Chennai, the police said.

articles.headline: Mumbai Rain In 5 Pics: Roads, Stations Flooded
articles.description: Mumbai Rain: Mumbai and its suburbs experienced heavy rain on Monday night and Tuesday morning, with several parts of the city inundated.

articles.headline: High Court Halts Demolition Drive, Top District Official Says Already Over
articles.description: The Patna High Court has stayed the demolition drive in the city's Nepali Nagar area, but the district magistrate said that by the time he received the order, the 40-acre land was cleared of encroachment.

articles.headline: Mumbai On Alert For Heavy Rain, Is Already Waterlogged
articles.description: Mumbai Rain: As heavy rain hit Mumbai and its suburbs last night and early this morning, parts of the city witnessed waterlogging and heavy traffic causing inconvenience to the residents.

articles.headline: UP Man Arrested, Sold Chicken Wrapped In Photos Of Gods, Say Cops
articles.description: A man was arrested in Uttar Pradesh for allegedly hurting religious sentiments by selling chicken on a piece of paper having pictures of Hindu deities, and also attacking a police team.

articles.headline: Jail Inmate Dies By Suicide In UP: Cops
articles.description: A man, who was arrested in a dowry death case, died by suicide in the district jail on Monday, a senior prison official said.

articles.headline: UP Woman Accuses Husband Of Giving Triple Talaq Over Dowry: Cops
articles.description: A woman here has alleged that her husband, who had been harassing her for dowry, divorced her through the outlawed practice of 'triple talaq,' police said on Monday.

articles.headline: Ragpicker Arrested For Killing 2 Men With Stones In Mumbai And Goa: Cops
articles.description: A 23 year-old ragpicker was arrested on Monday for allegedly killing two men by smashing their heads with stones in separate incidents in Mumbai and Goa, a police official said.

articles.headline: Alert For Moderate To Heavy Rain In Delhi On July 6: Weather Department
articles.description: Delhi Rain Forecast: The India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for Tuesday and an orange alert for Wednesday, warning of moderate to heavy rain or thundeshowers.

articles.headline: He Entered Mamata Banerjee's Home Thinking It Was This
articles.description: The man who sneaked past security guards and entered the premises of Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee's residence in the city has told the police that he had done so thinking it was the Kolkata Police headquarters, a senior police official said.

articles.headline: Man Stabbed To Death In Delhi Road Rage Incident: Police
articles.description: In a case of road rage, a 20-year-old man died after he was allegedly stabbed with a pointed object outside a wine shop in east Delhi's Samaspur area, police said on Monday.

articles.headline: 'Kejriwal Anthem' Singer Among 5 New Ministers In Bhagwant Mann's Punjab Government
articles.description: Anmol Gagan Maan and 3 other first-time MLAs in second batch of ministers sworn in after AAP came to power in Punjab; senior leader Aman Arora also gets a spot

articles.headline: AAP's Durgesh Pathak Takes Oath As Rajinder Nagar Legislator
articles.description: Newly-elected Rajinder Nagar Member of Legislative Assembly (MLA) Durgesh Pathak took oath of office on the first day of the Delhi Assembly session here on Monday.

articles.headline: "Let People Decide": Uddhav Thackeray's Poll Dare To Eknath Shinde, BJP
articles.description: "This is the BJP's ploy to end the Shiv Sena," Uddhav Thackeray told district unit heads, hours after Eknath Shinde-led government proved majority

articles.headline: Delhi Government Installs CCTV Cameras At Critical Waterlogging Points
articles.description: With an aim to ensure constant monitoring of critical waterlogging points in the city, the Delhi government has installed CCTV cameras at such places.

articles.headline: Heavy Rain In Parts Of Goa, Streets Flooded, Traffic Affected
articles.description: Several low lying areas in Goa were inundated due to heavy rains in the early hours of Monday, with water-logging near the premier health facility Goa Medical College & Hospital (GMCH) inconveniencing patients and their relatives, officials said.

articles.headline: Delhi Assembly Clears 66% Hike In Salaries Of Its Members
articles.description: The Delhi Assembly on Monday passed bills pertaining to over 66 per cent hike in salaries and allowances of its members who are among the lowest-paid lawmakers in the country.

articles.headline: Delhi High Court Adjourns Hearing On Umar Khalid's Bail Plea
articles.description: The Delhi High Court on Monday adjourned the hearing on the bail plea of Umar Umar Khalid in the North East Delhi violence case due to the non-availability of his counsel. His counsel senior advocate Trideep Pais has contracted COVID-19.

articles.headline: Woman Passenger Jumps In Front Of Moving Metro In Delhi: Report
articles.description: A woman passenger was injured on Monday after she allegedly jumped in front of a moving metro train and got hit, leading to a brief delay in services on a section of the Yellow Line, sources said.

articles.headline: Video: Delhi Man, Annoyed With Barking, Hits Dog And Neighbours
articles.description: A man attacked three people with an iron rod in Delhi's Paschim Vihar after his neighbour's dog barked at him and also bit him, the police said.

articles.headline: Woman, Her Baby Among 3 Killed After Being Hit By Truck In Maharashtra
articles.description: Three persons, including a six-month-old child, were killed after being hit by a truck in Pirangut area on the outskirts of Pune city of Maharashtra on Sunday evening, police said.

articles.headline: School Student Arrested For Murdering Teacher In Ayodhya: Police
articles.description: A student of class 12 was arrested by Uttar Pradesh Police in Ayodhya on Sunday for allegedly murdering his teacher. According to the police, the arrested boy was in a relationship with the victim.

articles.headline: Eknath Shinde Takes Back Key Party Post Before Test To Prove Majority
articles.description: In a major setback to the Uddhav Thackeray faction a day before the crucial trust vote of the Eknath Shinde-BJP government, the newly-appointed speaker of the Maharashtra Assembly on Sunday night removed Ajay Chaudhary as the legislative party leader

articles.headline: Over 18.35 Lakh People Still Affected, 5 More Die In Assam Floods
articles.description: Assam's flood situation improved on Sunday as the number of affected people declined to over 18.35 lakh from the previous day's 22.17 lakh even as five more persons lost their lives due to the deluge, an official bulletin said.

articles.headline: Delhi Assembly's Two-Day Monsoon Session To Start From Tomorrow
articles.description: The two-day Monsoon session of the Delhi Assembly will commence on Monday, in which the AAP government will table a Bill to increase the salaries of MLAs, an Assembly bulletin said.

articles.headline: Man Kills Wife With Axe Over Dowry Dispute In UP: Cops
articles.description: In a dispute over dowry, a man killed his wife with an axe in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida, the police said on Sunday. The police have arrested the man.

articles.headline: 4 Killed In Cylinder Blast At Punjab Wedding
articles.description: Four people were killed and three injured in a cylinder explosion during a wedding ceremony in the Jalalabad area of Punjab's Fazilka district on Saturday.

articles.headline: Odisha College Student Ends Life In Hostel Allegedly Over Ragging: Police
articles.description: A 19-year-old student of the prestigious BJB Autonomous College in Bhubaneswar allegedly died by suicide in her hostel on Saturday, sparking apprehension that she ended her life due to ragging by seniors, police said.

articles.headline: Touchdown Mumbai After 10-Day Power Trip: Sena Rebels Back As Victors But Not Home Yet
articles.description: Eknath Shinde's Sena of rebels returned to Mumbai from Goa, ahead of two-day assembly session for Speaker's election and trust vote

articles.headline: BJP Leader Becomes Sarpanch But Assaults Poll Staff In Madhya Pradesh: Here's Why
articles.description: Polling staff, including two cops, injured in attack by BJP leader and supporters in Bankabedi village of Madhya Pradesh's Narmadapuram district

articles.headline: Pregnant Woman Found Dead After Lover Slits Her Throat In UP: Cops
articles.description: A pregnant woman was found dead in Uttar Pradesh's Fatehpur after her lover slit her throat, the police said. The man was later arrested by the police.

articles.headline: BJP's Smriti Irani Targets KCR Amid Row Over PM Visit
articles.description: Telangana Chief Minister did not receive PM Modi but welcomed Yashwant Sinha just hours before that at the airport
